textContent:
A JAR (Java Archive) file is a file format used to package Java classes and related resources into a single file for distribution. It is similar to a ZIP file, but it contains additional metadata that is used by the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) at runtime.

JAR files are used for many purposes in Java, including packaging libraries, applications, and applets. They can contain compiled Java classes, images, text files, and other resources that are needed by a Java program. When a Java program runs, the JVM can load the classes and resources from a JAR file and use them as needed.

JAR files can be created using the jar command-line tool that comes with the Java Development Kit (JDK). JAR files can also be opened and manipulated using various archive tools, such as WinZip, 7-Zip, and others.

In summary, a JAR file is a way to package Java classes and related resources into a single file for distribution, and it is an essential component of many Java applications and libraries.
title: .jar
